request.description:
### Tenant Authentication Login

This endpoint is used to authenticate a tenant and obtain a token for accessing protected resources.

#### Request Body

- `user_identifier` (text) - The identifier of the user.
- `password` (text) - The password of the user.
    

#### Response

- `response_code` - The response code indicating the status of the request.
- `message` - A message related to the response.
- `content.token` - The authentication token obtained upon successful login.
- `errors` - An array of any errors encountered during the authentication process.

item.name: Get Reservation Details by Branch and ID

request.description:
### POST /v1/delivery-man/invite

This endpoint is used to send an invitation to a delivery man.

#### Request Body

- username (text): The username of the delivery man.
- email (text): The email address of the delivery man.
- country_code (text): The country code of the delivery man's phone number.
- phone (text): The phone number of the delivery man.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
    "response_code": "registration_200",
    "message": "successfully registered",
    "content": {
        "success": true,
        "token": "IWpiCHk3cC617MCK",
        "token_type": "invitation",
        "expires_in": "2024-06-13T07:50:24.000000Z"
    },
    "errors": []
}

 ```

### Delete Delivery Man

This endpoint is used to delete a specific delivery man.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
- Endpoint: {{baseUrlDeliveryService}}/v1/delivery-man/9c4476a8-5cd0-459f-a327-79d88540cff9
- Body (x-www-form-urlencoded):
    - account_status (text):
    - first_name (text):
    - last_name (text):

#### Response

- Status: 200
- Content-Type: application/json
- Body:
    
    ``` json
    {
        "response_code": "",
        "message": "",
        "content": null,
        "errors": []
    }
    
     ```

### GET /v1/delivery-man/assigned-from-branch/{branchId}

This endpoint retrieves the list of delivery men assigned from a specific branch.

#### Request Body

- `username` (text): The username of the delivery man.
- `email` (text): The email address of the delivery man.
- `country_code` (text): The country code of the delivery man's phone number.
- `phone` (text): The phone number of the delivery man.
    

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "response_code": "",
  "message": "",
  "content": {
    "current_page": 0,
    "data": [
      {
        "id": "",
        "restaurant_id": "",
        "first_name": null,
        "last_name": null,
        "username": "",
        "email": "",
        "phone": "",
        "account_status": "",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "created_at": "",
        "updated_at": ""
      }
    ],
    "first_page_url": "",
    "from": 0,
    "last_page": 0,
    "last_page_url": "",
    "links": [
      {
        "url": null,
        "label": "",
        "active": true
      }
    ],
    "next_page_url": null,
    "path": "",
    "per_page": 0,
    "prev_page_url": null,
    "to": 0,
    "total": 0
  },
  "errors": []
}

 ```

The `content` field contains an array of delivery men with their details such as `id`, `restaurant_id`, `username`, `email`, `phone`, `account_status`, `created_at`, and `updated_at`.

Status Code: 200 (OK)

Content Type: application/json

### Remove Delivery Man from Branch

This API endpoint is used to remove a delivery man from a branch.

#### Request

- Method: POST
- Base URL: {{baseUrlDeliveryService}}
- Path: /v1/delivery-man/remove-from-branch
- Body (x-www-form-urlencoded):
    - `delivery_man_id` (text): The ID of the delivery man to be removed from the branch.
    - `branch_id` (text): The ID of the branch from which the delivery man is to be removed.

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "response_code": {"type": "string"},
    "message": {"type": "string"},
    "content": {"type": "null"},
    "errors": {"type": "array"}
  }
}

 ```

- Status: 500
- Content-Type: application/json
    

The response contains the following properties:

- `response_code` (string): The code indicating the status of the response.
- `message` (string): A message providing information about the response.
- `content` (null): This field is null as per the response.
- `errors` (array): An array containing any errors encountered during the request processing.

### Add Delivery

This endpoint allows you to add a new delivery by providing the necessary details.

#### Request Body

- `order_id` (text): The ID of the order.
- `delivery_type` (text): The type of delivery.
- `entity_id` (text): The ID of the entity.
- `status` (text): The status of the delivery.
- `pickup_time` (text): The time of pickup.
- `delivery_time` (text): The time of delivery.
- `delivery_zone_id` (text): The ID of the delivery zone.
    

#### Response

- Status: 422
- Content-Type: application/json
- `response_code`: The code indicating the response status.
- `message`: A message related to the response.
- `content`: The content of the response, which is null in this case.
- `errors`: Details of any errors encountered, such as `pickup_time` and `delivery_time` errors.

This HTTP GET request retrieves a list of shifts from the delivery service API. The request includes query parameters for limiting the number of results and setting an offset for pagination.

### Request

- Endpoint: `{{baseUrlDeliveryService}}/v1/shift`
- Method: GET
- Query Parameters:
    - `limit` (integer): Limits the number of shifts to be returned.
    - `offset` (integer): Sets the offset for pagination.

### Response

The response is in JSON format and includes the following fields:

- `current_page` (integer): The current page of the results.
- `data` (array): An array of shift objects, each containing the following fields:
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the shift.
    - `restaurant_id` (string): The identifier of the restaurant associated with the shift.
    - `name` (string): The name of the shift.
    - `start_time` (string): The start time of the shift.
    - `end_time` (string): The end time of the shift.
    - `status` (string): The status of the shift.
    - `created_at` (string): The timestamp of when the shift was created.
    - `updated_at` (string): The timestamp of when the shift was last updated.
- `first_page_url` (string): The URL of the first page of results.
- `from` (integer): The index of the first item in the current page.
- `last_page` (integer): The index of the last page of results.
- `last_page_url` (string): The URL of the last page of results.
- `links` (array): An array of link objects, each containing the following fields:
    - `url` (string): The URL of the link.
    - `label` (string): The label of the link.
    - `active` (boolean): Indicates if the link is active.
- `next_page_url` (string): The URL of the next page of results, if available.
- `path` (string): The path of the current request.
- `per_page` (integer): The number of items per page.
- `prev_page_url` (string): The URL of the previous page of results, if available.
- `to` (integer): The index of the last item in the current page.
- `total` (integer): The total number of shifts.
    

### Example

``` json
{
  "current_page": 1,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "123",
      "restaurant_id": "456",
      "name": "Shift 1",
      "start_time": "2022-01-01T08:00:00",
      "end_time": "2022-01-01T16:00:00",
      "status": "active",
      "created_at": "2022-01-01T07:00:00",
      "updated_at": "2022-01-01T15:00:00"
    },
    {
      "id": "124",
      "restaurant_id": "457",
      "name": "Shift 2",
      "start_time": "2022-01-02T08:00:00",
      "end_time": "2022-01-02T16:00:00",
      "status": "inactive",
      "created_at": "2022-01-02T07:00:00",
      "updated_at": "2022-01-02T15:00:00"
    }
  ],
  "first_page_url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=1",
  "from": 1,
  "last_page": 3,
  "last_page_url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=3",
  "links": [
    {
      "url": null,
      "label": "Previous",
      "active": false
    },
    {
      "url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=2",
      "label": "Next",
      "active": true
    }
  ],
  "next_page_url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=2",
  "path": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift",
  "per_page": 2,
  "prev_page_url": null,
  "to": 2,
  "total": 6
}

 ```

## Request

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of third-party entities with a specified limit and offset.

### Query Parameters

- `limit` (integer): The number of items to retrieve.
- `offset` (integer): The offset for paginating through the results.
    

## Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "response_code": "",
  "message": "",
  "content": {
    "current_page": 0,
    "data": [
      {
        "id": "",
        "name": "",
        "configuration": {
          "api_key": "",
          "endpoint": "",
          "api_secret": ""
        },
        "status": "",
        "created_at": null,
        "updated_at": null
      }
    ],
    "first_page_url": "",
    "from": 0,
    "last_page": 0,
    "last_page_url": "",
    "links": [
      {
        "url": null,
        "label": "",
        "active": true
      }
    ],
    "next_page_url": null,
    "path": "",
    "per_page": 0,
    "prev_page_url": null,
    "to": 0,
    "total": 0
  },
  "errors": []
}

 ```

The `content` field contains an array of third-party entities, each with an `id`, `name`, `configuration`, `status`, `created_at`, and `updated_at` properties. The `configuration` object includes `api_key`, `endpoint`, and `api_secret` properties.

### POST /v1/delivery-man/invite

This endpoint is used to send an invitation to a delivery man.

#### Request Body

- username (text): The username of the delivery man.
- email (text): The email address of the delivery man.
- country_code (text): The country code of the delivery man's phone number.
- phone (text): The phone number of the delivery man.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
    "response_code": "registration_200",
    "message": "successfully registered",
    "content": {
        "success": true,
        "token": "IWpiCHk3cC617MCK",
        "token_type": "invitation",
        "expires_in": "2024-06-13T07:50:24.000000Z"
    },
    "errors": []
}

 ```

### Delete Delivery Man

This endpoint is used to delete a specific delivery man.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
- Endpoint: {{baseUrlDeliveryService}}/v1/delivery-man/9c4476a8-5cd0-459f-a327-79d88540cff9
- Body (x-www-form-urlencoded):
    - account_status (text):
    - first_name (text):
    - last_name (text):

#### Response

- Status: 200
- Content-Type: application/json
- Body:
    
    ``` json
    {
        "response_code": "",
        "message": "",
        "content": null,
        "errors": []
    }
    
     ```

This HTTP GET request retrieves a list of shifts from the delivery service API. The request includes query parameters for limiting the number of results and setting an offset for pagination.

### Request

- Endpoint: `{{baseUrlDeliveryService}}/v1/shift`
- Method: GET
- Query Parameters:
    - `limit` (integer): Limits the number of shifts to be returned.
    - `offset` (integer): Sets the offset for pagination.

### Response

The response is in JSON format and includes the following fields:

- `current_page` (integer): The current page of the results.
- `data` (array): An array of shift objects, each containing the following fields:
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the shift.
    - `restaurant_id` (string): The identifier of the restaurant associated with the shift.
    - `name` (string): The name of the shift.
    - `start_time` (string): The start time of the shift.
    - `end_time` (string): The end time of the shift.
    - `status` (string): The status of the shift.
    - `created_at` (string): The timestamp of when the shift was created.
    - `updated_at` (string): The timestamp of when the shift was last updated.
- `first_page_url` (string): The URL of the first page of results.
- `from` (integer): The index of the first item in the current page.
- `last_page` (integer): The index of the last page of results.
- `last_page_url` (string): The URL of the last page of results.
- `links` (array): An array of link objects, each containing the following fields:
    - `url` (string): The URL of the link.
    - `label` (string): The label of the link.
    - `active` (boolean): Indicates if the link is active.
- `next_page_url` (string): The URL of the next page of results, if available.
- `path` (string): The path of the current request.
- `per_page` (integer): The number of items per page.
- `prev_page_url` (string): The URL of the previous page of results, if available.
- `to` (integer): The index of the last item in the current page.
- `total` (integer): The total number of shifts.
    

### Example

``` json
{
  "current_page": 1,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "123",
      "restaurant_id": "456",
      "name": "Shift 1",
      "start_time": "2022-01-01T08:00:00",
      "end_time": "2022-01-01T16:00:00",
      "status": "active",
      "created_at": "2022-01-01T07:00:00",
      "updated_at": "2022-01-01T15:00:00"
    },
    {
      "id": "124",
      "restaurant_id": "457",
      "name": "Shift 2",
      "start_time": "2022-01-02T08:00:00",
      "end_time": "2022-01-02T16:00:00",
      "status": "inactive",
      "created_at": "2022-01-02T07:00:00",
      "updated_at": "2022-01-02T15:00:00"
    }
  ],
  "first_page_url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=1",
  "from": 1,
  "last_page": 3,
  "last_page_url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=3",
  "links": [
    {
      "url": null,
      "label": "Previous",
      "active": false
    },
    {
      "url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=2",
      "label": "Next",
      "active": true
    }
  ],
  "next_page_url": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift?page=2",
  "path": "https://api.example.com/v1/shift",
  "per_page": 2,
  "prev_page_url": null,
  "to": 2,
  "total": 6
}

 ```
